## formatString() function

Simple sprintf implementation:

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare function formatString(format: string, ...args: SprintfArg[]): string;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

format


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

The format string


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

args


</td><td>

SprintfArg\[\]


</td><td>

The format arguments


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

string

The formatted string

Supported format: %% %s %c %d, %i, %u %f %x, %X, %o

Supported flags: - (left align) + (always show sign for number) (space if no sign for number) 0 (zero pad) \# (alternate form, for x/X/o adds 0x/0X/0o prefix if value is non-zero) \* (width or precision from argument) n$ (explicit argument index, 1-based) .precision for s (max length) .precision for d/i/u/x/X/o (min digits) .precision for f (number of digits after decimal point, default 6)

## Example


```ts
formatString('Hello %s', 'World'); // 'Hello World'
formatString('Hex: %#x', 255); // 'Hex: 0xff'
formatString('Width: %*d', 5, 42); // 'Width:    42'
formatString('Pi: %.2f', Math.PI); // 'Pi: 3.14'
formatString('Index: %2$s %1$s', 'first', 'second'); // 'Index: second first'
```
